word_mean: 钢件淬硬后，再加热到Ac1点以下的某一温度，保温一定时间，然后冷却到室温的热处理工艺。

sentence.Network_en: It's a new process for tempering steel.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一种新的炼钢方法.

sentence.Network_en: There are three main operations in the heat treatment of steel: hardening, tempering and annealing.
sentence.Network_cn: 钢的热处理操作主要有三种,即: 淬火, 回火和退火.

sentence.Network_en: For real tempering this time we have to thank the Rightists.
sentence.Network_cn: 真正讲锻炼,这一回还是要感谢右派.

encyclopedia.content: 刚毛藻属 Cladophora 绿藻门刚毛藻科的一属。植物体为多细胞分枝的丝状体，附着生长在基质上；基部细胞有假根、或呈假根状，其他细胞柱状；有的老年个体因脱离附着物而漂浮；一年生或多年生。每个细胞有1个大的中央液泡，幼时叶绿体为1个，网状，老时可分散成为多数的颗粒状，蛋白核多数，细胞核多数 。细胞壁极厚，常有层次，表面的角质层含有70%的蛋白质 ，常粗糙，以至其上常有许多藻类附生 。本属约160种 ，除极冷地点外，海水

entry.def: If you refer to someone's temper or say that they have a temper, you mean that they become angry very easily.

example.ex: He had a temper and could be nasty...
example.tran: 他脾气不大好，有时凶得很。

example.ex: His short temper had become notorious...
example.tran: 他的臭脾气是出了名的。

entry.def: Your temper is the way you are feeling at a particular time. If you are in a good temper, you feel cheerful. If you are in a bad temper, you feel angry and impatient.

example.ex: I was in a bad temper last night...
He was in a very good temper...

entry.def: To temper something means to make it less extreme.

example.ex: For others, especially the young and foolish, the state will temper justice with mercy...
example.tran: 对待其他人时，尤其是年轻人和愚蠢的人，国家会刚柔并济。

example.ex: He had to learn to temper his enthusiasm.
example.tran: 他得学着给自己的热情降温。

entry.def: If someone is in a temper or gets into a temper, the way that they are behaving shows that they are feeling angry and impatient.

example.ex: She was still in a temper when Colin arrived...
example.tran: 科林到的时候，她气还没有消。

example.ex: When I try to explain how I feel he just flies into a temper.
example.tran: 我刚要解释我心里是怎么想的，他就勃然大怒。

entry.def: If you lose your temper, you become so angry that you shout at someone or show in some other way that you are no longer in control of yourself.

example.ex: I've never seen him get cross or lose his temper...
example.tran: 我从未见过他生气或者发火。

example.ex: I lost my temper and banged my book down on the desk.
example.tran: 我大发雷霆，把书砰地往课桌上一摔。

auth_sentence.content: Celtic manager Neil Lennon is already tempering expectations with reminders that he will struggle to hold onto his squad.
auth_sentence.res_content: Celtic manager Neil Lennon is already tempering expectations with reminders that he will struggle to hold onto his squad.
